entities.name: Origami
entities.description: Origami, the ancient Japanese art of paper folding, has captivated people around the world for centuries. It involves transforming a flat sheet of paper into intricate three-dimensional structures through a series of folds.

attributes.Applications: Engineering, Architecture, Material Science, Computer Science, Robotics, Artificial Intelligence

entities.name: Japanese
entities.description: The Japanese are an ethnic group native to Japan, known for their rich cultural heritage and contributions to various fields including art, technology, and mathematics.

entities.name: paper folding techniques
entities.description: Paper folding techniques involve the precise manipulation of paper to create specific shapes and forms, guided by mathematical principles such as symmetry, proportion, and geometry.

attributes.Complexity: Involves complex mathematical principles and theories
attributes.Purpose: To create precise and accurate shapes and forms
attributes.Manipulation Focus: Edges, angles, and vertices of the paper

entities.name: mathematical principles
entities.description: Mathematical principles are fundamental concepts and rules that govern the structure and behavior of mathematical systems. In origami, these principles include symmetry, geometry, proportion, ratio, graph theory, and computational geometry.

attributes.Examples: Symmetry, Geometry, Proportion, Ratio, Graph Theory, Computational Geometry
attributes.Application in Origami: Enhancing beauty, ensuring stability and balance, guiding precise folds, creating intricate designs, exploring new frontiers in various fields

entities.name: theorems
entities.description: Theorems are statements that have been proven to be true based on axioms or other theorems. In the context of origami, new geometric theorems have been developed through the intersection of mathematics and origami.

entities.name: proportion
entities.description: Proportion is a mathematical concept that describes the relationship between two quantities, often expressed as a ratio. It plays a crucial role in ensuring that folds and creases of paper align correctly to create precise and accurate shapes in origami.

attributes.Definition: A comparison of two quantities by division
attributes.Application: Ensuring correct alignment of folds and creases in origami

entities.name: enthusiasts
entities.description: Enthusiasts are individuals who have a strong interest and passion for origami, often engaging in the creation of intricate designs with precision and accuracy.

entities.name: angles
entities.description: Angles are geometric shapes formed by two rays or line segments that share a common endpoint. In the context of origami, angles play a crucial role in determining how paper can be folded to create specific forms and designs.

attributes.Definition: A geometric shape formed by two rays or line segments that share a common endpoint.
attributes.Importance in Origami: Angles are essential for creating precise folds and determining the structural integrity of origami models.

entities.name: dimensions
entities.description: Dimensions are measurable aspects of an object or space, such as length, width, and height. In the context of origami, dimensions play a crucial role in determining how paper can be folded to create specific forms.

attributes.Role in Origami: Determining how paper can be folded to create specific forms
attributes.Relationship with Proportions: Understanding the relationship between dimensions and proportions helps origami artists scale their designs while maintaining structural integrity.

entities.name: material science
entities.description: Material science is an interdisciplinary field that involves the discovery and design of new materials, with a focus on understanding their properties and behaviors.

attributes.Interdisciplinary Nature: Involves multiple disciplines such as physics, chemistry, and engineering.
attributes.Focus Areas: Discovery and design of new materials, understanding material properties and behaviors.

entities.description: Engineers and designers are professionals who apply scientific, mathematical, and artistic principles to create functional and aesthetically pleasing structures, devices, and systems.

entities.name: deployable solar panels
entities.description: Deployable solar panels are innovative structures developed using origami-inspired principles. They can be folded and unfolded with ease, making them efficient for various applications.
